name: Fractured Presidents Trivia Quiz | Fractured People | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
Richard Nixon.

	They called him 'Tricky Dick.' Watergate brought him down. 1969-1974.

Martin Van Buren.

	1837-1841.

Abraham Lincoln.

	My favorite President. A witty, complicated man. President during the Civil War. 1861-1865.

Theodore Roosevelt.

	The Teddy bear was named for him. Championed the environment before anyone called it that. 1901-1909.

Jimmy Carter & James Carter.

	My second favorite President. Maybe he can help us out of this mess we're in. 1977-1981.

Zachary Taylor.

	1849-1850.

questions.correct: Ulysses S. Grant & Ulysses S Grant & Ulysses Grant
questions.explanation:
Ulysses S. Grant & Ulysses S Grant & Ulysses Grant

	A Civil War general. 1869-1877.

questions.correct: Dwight D. Eisenhower & Dwight D Eisenhower & Dwight Eisenhower
questions.explanation:
Dwight D. Eisenhower & Dwight D Eisenhower & Dwight Eisenhower

	A World War II general. President during the Cold War. 1953-1961.

Calvin Coolidge.

	1923-1929.

questions.correct: Rutherford B. Hayes & Rutherford B Hayes & Rutherford Hayes
questions.explanation:
Rutherford B. Hayes & Rutherford B Hayes & Rutherford Hayes

	1877-1881.

James Buchanan.

	1857-1861.

Benjamin Harrison.

	1889-1893.

John Tyler.

	1841-1845. Did you know he has living grandchildren as of 2002? It's true.

questions.correct: Chester A. Arthur & Chester A Arthur & Chester Arthur
questions.explanation:
Chester A. Arthur & Chester A Arthur & Chester Arthur

	1881-1885.

questions.text: Well yum jiffy soon clinch town
questions.explanation:
William Jefferson Clinton.

	I thought he was a pretty good President, despite Monica. 1993-2001.

questions.correct: Lyndon B. Johnson & Lyndon B Johnson & Lyndon Johnson
questions.explanation:
Lyndon B. Johnson & Lyndon B Johnson & Lyndon Johnson

	LBJ helped pass some great Civil Rights legislation. The Vietnam War brought him down. 1963-1969.

John Quincy Adams.

	Rumor has it he disliked being President. Son of the first President Adams. 1825-1829.

questions.correct: Gerald R. Ford & Gerald R Ford & Gerald Ford
questions.explanation:
Gerald R. Ford & Gerald R Ford & Gerald Ford

	Pardoned Richard Nixon. Ford was the only man who became president and vice president without being elected to either office. He stepped into the vice presidency after Spiro Agnew resigned. He became president after Richard Nixon's resignation. The press was always catching him stumbling. His wife Betty was very popular (and has a clinic named after her). 1974-1977.

Andrew Jackson.

	1829-1837. Our first "Western" President.

Millard Fillmore.

	1850-1853.

Franklin Pierce.

	1853-1857.

questions.correct: Harry S. Truman & Harry S Truman & Harry Truman
questions.explanation:
Harry S. Truman & Harry S Truman & Harry Truman

	Took over when FDR died. I wish he had not ordered the use of atomic weapons at the end of WWII. 1945-1953.

questions.correct: Warren G. Harding & Warren G Harding & Warren Harding
questions.explanation:
Warren G. Harding & Warren G Harding & Warren Harding

	1921-1923.

Grover Cleveland.

	1885-1889 and 1893-1897. The only President to serve two terms separated by another person's presidency (Benjamin Harrison's). Cleveland was the 22nd and 24th President.

Woodrow Wilson.

	1913-1921. President during World War I. Helped to start the League of Nations.
